name: Moroccan Tomato Soup
description: This recipe, originally featured in a 1991 column by Barbara Kafka, was rehashed in a piece by Amanda Hesser in 2009. The idea is simple: Aromatic spices are toasted in a small saucepan, paired with tomatoes, and served chilled. The end result is a refreshing soup, full of flavor.
recipeCategory: dinner, lunch, quick, one pot, soups and stews
keywords: appetizer, main course, side dish, garlic, tomato, gluten-free, vegan, vegetarian, summer
recipeIngredient: 5 medium cloves garlic, smashed, peeled and minced
2 1/4 pounds tomatoes, cored and cut into 1-inch pieces
1/4 cup packed chopped cilantro leaves plus additional for garnish
2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, stir together the garlic, paprika, cumin, cayenne and olive oil. Place over medium-low heat and cook, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.

Pass the tomatoes through a food mill fitted with a large disk. Stir in the cooked spice mixture, the cilantro, vinegar, lemon juice, 2 teaspoons salt, celery and 2 tablespoons water. Add more salt as desired. Refrigerate until cold. Serve garnished with cilantro leaves.
